subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|むかし}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=むかし|-}}. The ''muka'' portion derives from the {{m|ja|未然形|tr=mizenkei||incomplete form}} of verb {{m|ja|向く|tr=muku||to face opposite to something}}, implying “that which stands opposite from the present”. The ''shi'' portion is suffix {{m|ja|し|tr=shi}} indicating [[direction]], also found in words {{m|ja|縦し|tr=tatashi||the standing or vertical direction}}, {{m|ja|横し|tr=yokoshi||the sideways or horizontal direction}}. This appears to be a somewhat rare alternative form, more commonly encountered as {{m|ja|さ|tr=sa}}, and may be cognate with the nominalizing adjective ending {{m|ja|さ|tr=sa}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>
